bullets.text: Trump administration will end U.S. security programs shielding European allies from Russia, potentially weakening deterrence on continent.
Trump claims authority to summarily kill suspected drug smugglers, signaling harsher extraterritorial counternarcotics posture.
After Ecuador boat strike, Sen. Rubio says U.S. will help partners blow up crime groups, foreshadowing escalated regional security cooperation.
Trump formalizes lower tariffs on Japanese autos; Asia-Pacific stocks open higher on trade optimism.
ADP estimates U.S. added 54,000 jobs in August, underscoring cooling labor market ahead of payrolls.
S&P 500 hits record as falling yields offer relief, though bond market divergence warns of volatility.
Broadcom jumps on mystery $10B AI customer and strong AI sales growth, reinforcing semiconductor demand strength.
Salesforce and Figma shares slide on weak outlooks, highlighting software growth deceleration despite AI enthusiasm.
T. Rowe Price spikes after $1B Goldman investment, signaling strategic capital partnerships in asset management.
Record numbers of savers now 401(k)/IRA millionaires, benefiting from market rally and higher contributions.
Orsted sues to save offshore wind farm from administration cancellation, spotlighting U.S. renewable policy uncertainty.
Honeywell’s Quantinuum advances toward key commercialization milestone, boosting quantum computing’s investability.
A 3-minute EEG-based brainwave test could detect Alzheimer’s years early, promising cheaper screening.
Mars quakes reveal new details of planetary interior, refining models of crust and mantle structure.
